title: How to Draw Pyramids

steps.headline: Choose the size of the front of your pyramid, e.g.
At the base of your pyramid draw the 5 centimeter (2.0 in) line.
steps.description: Using your compass, measure from the point to the pencil at 5 centimeter (2.0 in).

steps.headline: As shown in Fig.1, put your compass at one end of your baseline.
steps.description: Doing this, draw part of a circle. Repeat with other end of the baseline. Doing this, you should have both lines crossing in the middle. This part is difficult, but don't worry.

steps.headline: From the baseline to the cross, connect the two ends together so you end up with a triangle, shown in Fig.2.
Rub out the lines you used in part 3.
To one side, draw an extension like another side like in Fig.3.
steps.description: Make sure the baseline of that side is above the first baseline you drew.

text: Choose the size of the front of your pyramid, e.g. 5x5cm. At the base of your pyramid draw the 5 centimeter (2.0 in) line. Using your compass, measure from the point to the pencil at 5 centimeter (2.0 in). As shown in Fig.1, put your compass at one end of your baseline. Doing this, draw part of a circle. Repeat with other end of the baseline. Doing this, you should have both lines crossing in the middle. This part is difficult, but don't worry. From the baseline to the cross, connect the two ends together so you end up with a triangle, shown in Fig.2.  Rub out the lines you used in part 3.  To one side, draw an extension like another side like in Fig.3. Make sure the baseline of that side is above the first baseline you drew. Finished.
